result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael John Rueger

defendant.name: Rueger, Michael John
defendant.address: 422 W New York Ave, Oshkosh, WI 54901

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael John Rueger appeared by video.  Attorney Emily Jane Bell appeared by video for Michael John Rueger.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Defense acknowledges receipt of discovery and requests a status conference.  No objection from the State.  Court approves Zoom appearances at the next court date.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Status conference scheduled for December 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael John Rueger appeared by video.  Attorney Emily Jane Bell appeared by video for Michael John Rueger.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judicial notice of Defendant's 3 prior OWIs. Sworn for the State: MCSO Deputy B. Shank. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Branch 02.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael John Rueger in court, appear by video with attorney Emily Jane Bell, appear by video.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State subpoena the wrong witness. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael John Rueger in court with attorney Emily Jane Bell.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. 
Case in court for a Preliminary Hearing. State's witness is unavailable. State requests an adjournment. Defense move to dismiss. Court denies defense's motion and ordered case adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael John Rueger in court.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant appears by Zoom. Court gives defendant next court date off the record. Case adjourned for preliminary hearing, Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael John Rueger not in court.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case recalled. Defendant left the Zoom waiting room. Attorney Emily Bell has accepted the Court appointment. Court orders case adjourned to schedule preliminary hearing date.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael John Rueger in court.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant appears by Zoom. Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. Case passed to confirm attorney acceptance of appointment. Court finds defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel. Court orders an attorney to be appointed at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The Court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00 per month beginning the 1st of the month after the completion of the case, and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Court ordered case passed to confirm an attorney appointment.
Indigency hearing on June 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael John Rueger in court by video.  Erika Strebel appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Defendant appears without counsel.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.   Court orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.  Indigency hearing scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Michael John Rueger
Current: 422 W New York Ave, Oshkosh, WI 54901   (Effective: 03-23-2022)
Prior: 160 Fox Fire Drive, Oshkosh, WI 54904

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Michael John Rueger in court with attorney William Hotchkiss.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 4/13/22 @ 1p
